group.name: LSB 2.0
group.description: LSB 2.0 compatible runtime, plus additional features.

group.name: LSB 2.0 development support
group.description: A software development environment suitable for building applications for the LSB 2.0 component or any environment compatible with LSB 2.0. This component contains the GNU compiler collection (GCC) version 3.3, the GNU debugger (GDB) version 5.3, and many other GNU development tools.

group.name: Progeny Debian support
group.description: Progeny Debian branding and configuration defaults.

group.name: Audio support
group.description: Support for audio devices and file formats.

group.description: Support for a variety of graphics file formats.

group.name: Kerberos client support
group.description: Client support for the Kerberos authentication system.

group.description: The Python interpreted, interactive, object-oriented programming language, version 2.3.

group.description: An open-source, X Window System based desktop infrastructure.

group.description: The Java 2 Standard Edition (J2SE) runtime, version 1.4.

group.name: Mono
group.description: An open source implementation of the .NET framework.

group.name: Evolution 2.0
group.description: Evolution is an information management solution for individuals and workgroups, integrating email, calendaring, meeting scheduling, and contact management.

group.description: Mozilla Firefox is a preview release of the next generation of the Mozilla browser.

group.name: OpenOffice.org 1.1
group.description: OpenOffice.org is a multi-platform office productivity suite (word processor, spreadsheet, and presentation software) compatible with all major file formats.

group.name: Componentized Linux tools
group.description: Support for package, component, and custom distribution development.

group.description: The Linux kernel, version 2.6. This component contains support for kernel development and building custom kernels.

group.name: Java 2 Standard Edition 1.4 SDK
group.description: The Java 2 Standard Edition (J2SE) software development kit, version 1.4.

group.name: Java development support
group.description: A software development environment suitable for building applications for the Java platform. This component contains software from the Apache project (http://www.apache.org/), the Apache Jakarta project (http://jakarta.apache.org/), and other sources.

group.description: An open source implementation of the .NET framework. This component contains the software development support.

group.description: Evolution is an information management solution for individuals and workgroups, integrating email, calendaring, meeting scheduling, and contact management. This component contains the software development support.

group.name: GNU Emacs 21.3
group.description: GNU Emacs is the extensible, self-documenting, real-time display editor.

group.name: VIM 6.3
group.description: VI iMproved, an enhanced, vi-compatible editor.

group.description: The Eclipse open, extensible IDE. This component contains the software development support.

group.name: GIMP 2.0
group.description: The GIMP (GNU Image Manipulation Program is a powerful image editor for such tasks as image authoring, image composition, and photo retouching.

group.name: PHP 4.3
group.description: The server-side, HTML-embedded scripting language, version 4.3.

group.name: Tomcat 4.1
group.description: Tomcat is the servlet container that is used in the official Reference Implementation for the Java Servlet and JavaServer Pages technologies. The Java Servlet and JavaServer Pages specifications are developed by Sun under the Java Community Process.
